Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant's failure to disclose his marriage prior to becoming a permanent resident violated immigration regulations
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Paragraph 117(9)(d) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Applicant did not disclose marriage before landing
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Non-disclosure and lack of examination of spouse before applicant became permanent resident
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to update application with change in marital status
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness and correctness standards applied in judicial review
Crimes.Application_Factor: Marriage occurred in May 2004; not disclosed prior to landing
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Spouse does not qualify as family class member
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Procedural fairness and interpretation of regulation
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: No breach of procedural fairness found; decision upheld
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Applicant failed to disclose marital status change before landing in Canada
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to IAD decision on grounds of procedural fairness and statutory interpretation
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of process in administrative decision-making
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose material change in family status

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicantâ€™s failure to disclose marriage before becoming a permanent resident violated immigration regulations
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant married in May 2004 but did not update application or disclose change; spouse refused permanent residence due to lack of examination
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Spouse does not qualify as family class member
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Non-disclosure of marriage prior to landing
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Spouse not examined before applicant became permanent resident
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timing of marriage relative to landing and examination
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Timing and disclosure of marital status
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturning of IAD decision refusing spouse permanent residence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of timely disclosure and supporting documentation for spouse
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant failed to disclose marriage prior to becoming a Canadian permanent resident
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: No evidence submitted to support inclusion of spouse post-landing
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Requirement to disclose all family members before landing
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Undisputed that marriage was not disclosed pre-landing
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Spouse not examined before sponsor became permanent resident; thus ineligible under regulation
